channel.title: hashmapclass Solution: def findMaxLength(self, nums: List[int]) -> int: lookup = {} lookup[0] = -1 max_len = 0 count = 0 for i, num in enumerate(nums): count += 1 if num else -1 if count in lookup: max_len = max(max_len, i-lookup[count]) else: lookup[count] = i return max_len on Hashnopolis

item.title: Contiguous Array
item.description: Given a binary array, find the maximum length of a contiguous subarray with equal number of 0 and 1. Example 1 Input: [0,1] Output: 2 Explanation: [0, 1] is the longest contiguous subarray with equal number of 0 and 1. Example 2 Input: [0,1,0] Output: 2 Explanation: [0, 1] (or [1, 0]) is a longest contiguous subarray with equal number of 0 and 1. Note The length of the given binary array will not exceed 50,000.
